data.title: Error: Invalid problemMatcher description for correct problemMatcher
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.1 and 1.10.0-insiders

Given this defined task in tasks.json:
```json
		{
			"taskName": "watch",
			"command": "bash",
			"args": ["${workspaceRoot}/watch.sh"],
			"isBackground": true,
			"problemMatcher": {
				"pattern": "^[(.+)] (.+):\\[(\\d+),(\\d+)\\] (.*)$",
				"owner": "java",
				"fileLocation": "absolute"
			}
		}
```

which is correct according to https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/editor/tasks_appendix

trying to run it yields

```
Error: Invalid problemMatcher description. A matcher must at least define a pattern, owner and a file location. The problematic matcher is:
{
    "pattern": "^[(.+)] (.+):\\[(\\d+),(\\d+)\\] (.*)$",
    "owner": "java",
    "fileLocation": "relative"
}
```

error is logged here: https://sourcegraph.com/github.com/Microsoft/vscode@c342eaa22e172e1f51ef42860948e6a010fcfb1e/-/blob/src/vs/platform/markers/common/problemMatcher.ts#L766:1-767:1

data.title: Question: How to disable markdown preview sync
data.body:
Given how markdown preview sync is currently horribly broken if markdown has tables or images in it, I'd like to know how to disable this feature. It's getting in the way, by scrolling to the wrong place, and thus constantly hiding the right place that I'm currently editing.

Could you please let me know, what is the setting I need to change to disable this altogether?

Thank you in advance!

- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

![scrollissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3226984/22948812/bc4ddaea-f2b4-11e6-807c-7706e2dcafbf.gif)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Download, unzip archive: 
[scrollIssue.zip](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/files/775261/scrollIssue.zip)

2. Open in vscode
3. go to diff view
4. Press and hold on bottom horizontal scroll bar while it is atop a deleted region
5. Observe surprising downward scrolling.

data.title: ./scripts/test.sh requires ./scripts/code.sh to be run first
data.body:
In the course of debugging https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/20344 I discovered that `./scripts/test.sh` will immediately exit with no output if `./scripts/code.sh` has not first been run.

Reproduce:
1. Fresh checkout of vscode
2. `./scripts/npm.sh install`
3. `npm run watch`
4. `./scripts/test.sh`

`./scripts/test.sh` stops executing at this line:
```
INSTALLED_VERSION=`cat .build/electron/version 2> /dev/null`
```

If I run `cat .build/electron/version` myself, the output is this:

```
$ cat .build/electron/version
cat: .build/electron/version: No such file or directory
```

Workaround:
- Run `./scripts/code.sh` before running `./scripts/test.sh`

Ideal behavior:
- It would be nice if `./scripts/test.sh` handled installing electron itself.

data.title: XHTML-style closing html tag should be scoped as tag end
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.10.0-insider (1d17b45a11d8db22fe95c601f793a3cb9a582ba6, 2017-02-14T09:43:26.020Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.4.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|code-settings-sync|Shan|2.4.3|
|sort-lines|Tyriar|1.2.0|
|html-css-class-completion|Zignd|1.0.3|
|Bookmarks|alefragnani|0.11.0|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.2|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.6|
|python|donjayamanne|0.5.8|
|tslint|eg2|0.8.1|
|angular2|johnpapa|2.0.1|
|vscode-icon-theme|jtlowe|1.4.0|
|theme-karyfoundation-themes|karyfoundation|11.0.0|
|restructuredtext|lextudio|0.0.21|
|HTMLHint|mkaufman|0.3.3|
|vscode-autoprefixer|mrmlnc|2.0.0|
|vscode-stylefmt|mrmlnc|2.2.2|
|stylelint|shinnn|0.22.0|
|darcula-extended|smlombardi|3.3.2|
|slime|smlombardi|1.0.5|
|theme-tesla|smlombardi|6.0.0|
|change-case|wmaurer|1.0.0|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

When using a tag that still requires an XHTML-style unary closing tag `/>`, the `/` should be scoped to match the closing `>`.

As you can see, it's not, so all the `/` are white while all other `punctuation.definition.tag.end.html` are a different color:

![screen shot 2017-02-14 at 2 02 16 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/22944414/9f703918-f2be-11e6-81c6-84ee82d48361.png)

![screen shot 2017-02-14 at 2 02 41 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/835148/22944419/a3414f78-f2be-11e6-91b3-55cea3b99b49.png)

data.title: Debugger hangs on break points in PowerShell code
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.9.1 (f9d0c687ff2ea7aabd85fb9a43129117c0ecf519, 2017-02-09T00:26:45.394Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 6.1.7601
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|azuretoolsforvscode|bradygaster|1.2.1|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.9.0|
|azurerm-vscode-tools|msazurermtools|0.3.4|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Set a break point 
2. Press F10 to step the break point
3. The debugger hangs and Code must be restarted

1. Set a break point on a different line than the one that caused the debugger to hang.
2. Press F10 to step the break point
3. The debugger hangs and Code must be restarted

The same PowerShell code runs fine if there is not break points set.

data.title: Increase minimum limit for fontSize and lineHeight

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.0-insider
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open settings.json.
2. Enter without saving: `"editor.fontSize": 1` and wait.
3. Small font size is applied.

I would expect to have a font size lower bound when font size is applied dynamically without saving, or asking for confirmation on small font size. The user can enter number "1" and then have a think for another several seconds before deciding on second digit for the size.

UPDATE:
"files.autoSave": "afterDelay" has to be set. Thanks to @joaomoreno comment.

data.title: File > Recent: Allow for larger list

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Hi,

In Linux we usually handle long path files names. When opening the recent list from File menu, it's almost impossible to read file name, since the path is truncated. It happens, for example, when opening a SFTP place or a Samba share from Files that has this path:

/var/run/user/1000/gvfs/smb-share:server=fsX,share=YYY,user=USER/Applications/blabla/filename.TXT

If we can't make the menu larger in width, we could "cut" the path in middle, leaving the filename part visible (that's fundamental).
If we have a recent list showing ONLY paths, it's almost useless :-(



- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: Fedora 25

data.title: Debug adapter client sends "evaluate" request for watch variable after sending "continue" request
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.8, 1.9
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install PowerShell extension
2. Save this script into a .ps1 file

```powershell
$abcdef = 1
while ($abcdef -le 50)
{
Start-Sleep -Milliseconds 2000
$abcdef = $abcdef + 1
}
```

3. Set a breakpoint on lines 1 and 5 and run the script
4. When breakpoint on line 1 gets hit, set a watch for `$abcdef`
5. Hit continue
6. Debugger now hangs

For some reason, the debugger client is sending an `evaluate` request for the `$abcdef` watch variable after the `continue` request is sent and its response is received.  This seems like a bug to me.  Here's what I see in the PowerShell extension logs:

```

2/13/2017 5:07:31 PM [VERBOSE] - Method "ReadMessage" at line 111 of C:\Users\kborle\Source\Repos\PowerShellEditorServices\src\PowerShellEditorServices.Protocol\MessageProtocol\MessageReader.cs

    READ MESSAGE:
    
    {
      "command": "continue",
      "arguments": {
        "threadId": 1
      },
      "type": "request",
      "seq": 14
    }

2/13/2017 5:07:31 PM [VERBOSE] - Method "WriteMessage" at line 59 of C:\Users\kborle\Source\Repos\PowerShellEditorServices\src\PowerShellEditorServices.Protocol\MessageProtocol\MessageWriter.cs

    WRITE MESSAGE:
    
    {
      "type": "response",
      "request_seq": 14,
      "command": "continue",
      "success": true,
      "body": null
    }

2/13/2017 5:07:31 PM [VERBOSE] - Method "OnDebuggerStop" at line 1482 of C:\Users\kborle\Source\Repos\PowerShellEditorServices\src\PowerShellEditorServices\Session\PowerShellContext.cs

    Received debugger resume action Continue

2/13/2017 5:07:31 PM [VERBOSE] - Method "ReadMessage" at line 111 of C:\Users\kborle\Source\Repos\PowerShellEditorServices\src\PowerShellEditorServices.Protocol\MessageProtocol\MessageReader.cs

    READ MESSAGE:
    
    {
      "command": "evaluate",
      "arguments": {
        "expression": "$abcdef",
        "context": "watch"
      },
      "type": "request",
      "seq": 15
    }
```

The hang is ultimately our fault, but it's happening because we're getting the `evaluate` request at an unexpected moment.

/cc @kapilmb

data.title: Disable markdown formatting in showInformationMessage by default
data.body:
I've found an open issue (https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/6087) about markdown in show*Message. And I assume that this functionality is not implemented yet. But if I try to show message with `__`(double underscore), for example `abc__def`, underscore characters will be lost and the rest of the text will be italic. I have not found how to disable this type of formatting

- VSCode Version: 1.9.1
- OS Version: macOS Sierra 10.12.3

Steps to Reproduce:

1. just try `window.showInformationMessage('abc__def');`
2. and you'll get abcdef, but `def` in italic

data.title: Same file opened twice with different filename casing
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.9.0
- OS Version: OS X 10.11.6

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create file `a.ts` (note lower case)
```
import B from "B";
```

2. create file `b.ts` (note lower case)
```
export default class B {}
```

3. create file `tsconfig.json`
```
{
    "compilerOptions": {
        "module": "system"
    }
}
```

4. save all files
5. close all editors (cmd+w multiple times)
6. open `a.ts`
7. place cursor att the first `B`
8. hit F12
9. click on `b.ts` in explorer

Now `b.ts` is opened twice. Once as `b.ts`, once as `B.ts` and the two editors are independant with regards to save state.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/557685/22929313/4a357146-f2bb-11e6-9af0-2baca80f4d7a.png)
